original_title: Double-wattled Cassowary: Thailand sends three birds to Sri Lanka
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Three double-wattled Cassowary birds were brought down to Sri Lanka from Thailand, under the animal exchange programme.
The birds were brought to the Bandaranaike International Airport in Katunayake onboard the MH179 Malaysia Airlines flight from Kuala Lumpur in Malaysia.
The Cassowary grows to a height of about five feet and weighs about 60 kg, and has often been labeled "the world's most dangerous bird".
The birds were directed to the National Zoological Garden in Dehiwala, News 1st's correspondent reported.
Sri Lanka is also set to export various species of animals including monkeys, junglefowls and snakes, under the animal exchange programme.
